intro: Diplotaxis × wirtgenii, commonly known as the hybrid desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water, exhibiting succulent stems and deep root systems. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its spread in disturbed soils. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
